properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 8 at 7:52PM PST until January 9 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
A quick-moving storm system will bring mountain snow tonight.

* WHAT...Snowfall of 3 to 6 inches expected above 3500 feet.
Locally higher amounts in the Trinity Alps.

* WHERE...Northern Trinity County.

* WHEN...Until 7 AM Thursday.

* IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday
morning commute. Chains or snow tires may be needed over Scott
Mountain Summit.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hazardous travel conditions are expected
across Scott Mountain Summit on Highway 3. Some minor amounts
of 1 to 3 inches are possible along the highest portions of
Highway 36 to the east of South Fork Mountain.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM THURSDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET
